subject: Learning
title: Gurukul: India's Forest Schools
description: A quick win: understand Gurukul: India's Forest Schools.

hook.text: In ancient India, students left home to live in their teacher's forest dwelling for years.

buildup.text: The gurukul system was residential education: students served the guru while learning sacred texts.

discovery.text: Oral transmission was the method. The Vedas were memorized word-perfectly across generations without writing.

twist.text: Access depended on caste. Only upper-caste boys could attend, locking out most of the population.

climax.text: Yet the oral tradition preserved vast knowledge for millenniaâ€”proof that memory can rival the written word.

punchline.text: No books. No classrooms. Just a guru and a willing mind.

quiz.question: How were the Vedas preserved in the gurukul system?
options: Through exact oral memorization passed across generations
